question: Which of the following conditions is recombinant erythropoietin indicated for?

answers.option: Anemia due to chronic kidney disease

question: A patient may present with hemolytic anemia because of genetic mutations in protein synthesis. What is the most common inherited disorder causing anemia in humans in this connection?
What type of vaccine is the diphtheria vaccine?
A 35-year-old man with a history of intravenous (IV) drug abuse has generalized lymphadenopathy. Which of the following tests would help in finding the cause of his lymphadenopathy?

A 37-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of a lump in the right breast. The general physical examination concludes mass in the right upper quadrant of the breast and an enlarged right axial lymph node. She was diagnosed with Hodgkin lymphoma 7 years ago but was treated for it and completely cured. What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?
What type of immunity does a community acquire when a significant portion of its population gets an infection and subsequently becomes immune to it?
Which surgery most commonly causes deep vein thrombosis (DVT)?
What is the diagnostic test for deep vein thrombosis (DVT)?
An eye witness claims the victims death occurred about 12 hours ago. Which of the finding will confirm the statement?

answers.option: Rise in potassium content of vitreous humor
Increase in chemical constituents of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)

question: Essentially all endemic forms of Burkitt lymphoma are associated with which pathogen?
Which of the following is responsible to facilitate absorption of oral iron preparations?

A 6-year-old child, diagnosed with hereditary spherocytosis, complained of increased frequency of blood transfusions. Blood complete picture shows Hb=6.5 gm/dL, reticulocyte count=20%, TLC=4000/mm³, platelets=100,000/mm³. What will be the most appropriate treatment for this child?

A child is diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. He has generalized lymphadenopathy. Chest X-ray shows a mediastinal mass and CT abdomen shows enlarged, multiple mesentric, and para aortic lymph nodes. What is the most likely stage of the disease?

A patient presented with disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) due to sepsis by gram-negative bacteria in the emergency. Which one of the following is the first step for the management of DIC in this patient?
Systemic viral infection, particularly in children often produce which of the following?

A 4-year-old girl presents with skin pallor for the past 3 days. One week ago she had a history of bloody diarrhea. Examination showed petechiae on the upper limbs. Laboratory studies revealed Hb 7.1 g/dl, reticulocytes 14%, platelets 30x 109/L, and normal WBC count. The renal function is deranged. The peripheral smear features numerous schistocytes and occasional nucleated RBC. Given the findings, which of the following bacteria is involved in the pathophysiology of disease?
Stony hard lymph node is mostly suggestive of which of the following?
A 2-year-old child comes to the hospital for circumcision. His two brothers also had bleeding diathesis. Which test should be done?

A 45-year-old male who is bed-bound from paraplegia develops sudden shortness of breath. On examination, his right calf is found to be swollen and tender, a provisional diagnosis of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism is made. What will be the single most sought diagnostic test?
What is the most appropriate treatment for a 5-year-old child with hereditary spherocytosis, large spleen, with hemoglobin mostly remaining at 7-9gm/dl, and reticulocyte count at 12-15%?
Which investigation(s) is/are the first step investigating a case of thrombosis?
In which one of the following scenarios is vitamin K given?
Which of the following is donor blood screened for before a transfusion?

A 52-year-old patient presented to the clinic to get his blood reports examined. He was being investigated following his presentation to the clinic with a history of recurrent infections and easy fatiguability for 6 months. The peripheral film demonstrated peculiar monocytes twice the size of mature lymphocytes with round nuclei, abundant cytoplasm, and circumferential projections. An attempt to perform bone marrow aspiration revealed a dry tap. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?
Which condition shows both arterial and venous thrombosis?
What is the most likely gastrointestinal manifestation of acute graft-versus-host disease (GVHD)?

An 8-year-old child is brought to the hospital with complaints of fever for 2 months along with hepatomegaly and splenomegaly. Investigations show the following: Hb=4.8 gm/dl, TLC=1700/HPF, platelets=38000. Peripheral smear shows microcytic anemia with blast cells. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 22-year-old woman attends an antenatal booking appointment. She has had previous 3 miscarriages. She has mouth ulcers and joint pains and is evaluated for arthritis/ arthralgia. Which single pair of results are most likely to confirm the underlying cause of her symptoms?

answers.option: Increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) and rheumatoid factor
Increased activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) and decreased platelets
Increased lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) and increased bilirubin
Decreased hemoglobin and decreased mean corpuscular volume (MCV)

question: Which one of the following blood tests is done to detect sickle cell disease?

A 72-year-old man is brought to the emergency department with sudden onset of acute arterial occlusions of the right lower limb leading to gangrene of the lower leg and foot. He has lens subluxation and a long tapering finger. What is the most probable cause of this acute arterial occlusion?

A 10-year-old child with a known case of thalassemia major requires red cell transfusion every month, since the age of one year. For the last 5 to 6 months, he develops urticarial rashes during transfusion. What will be an appropriate step for management?

answers.option: Prior to transfusion, give him one shot of steroid
Prior to transfusion, give him antihistamine and antipyretic drugs

question: Which medical condition is not associated with venous thrombosis?
Which test is conducted to determine the cause of deficiency of vitamin B12?
Which of the following is not a cause of lymphocytosis?
The indication for hematopoietic stem cell transplants does not include the following?

A 70-year-old male presents to the hospital with severe backache. His investigations reveal Hb=7 gm/dl, creatinine=2 mg/dL, ESR= 110 mm/hour. What other finding is most likely to be found on investigations?
When is the second dose of the measles vaccine given?
Which one of the following is not a baseline investigation?
A baby undergoes circumcision and after the procedure the bleeding is prolonged. Upon inquiry, his brothers and sisters have had the same problem. What test should be done for the assessment?
The extrinsic pathway of coagulation is initiated by which of the following?
Which of the following is given to a patient suffering from hemophilia A?
Which of the following is a confirmatory test for finding red blood cells in spherocytosis?
According to the expanded program of immunization (EPI), the second dose of the measles vaccine is recommended to be given at what age?
What is the best long term treatment in a patient with cerebrovascular accident (CVA) after arterial thrombosis with anti-phospholipid syndrome?
Different blood products are transfused in different clinical conditions. Which product is required if a patient is bleeding actively and has deficiencies of multiple coagulation factors?
A 22-year-old African American man went to the hospital to determine if he has sickle cell trait. Which one of the following laboratory tests can be used to detect the presence of hemoglobin S?
An 11-year-old child is diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia. Which of the following is the most important factor in classifying leukemia as a high-risk group?

answers.option: Age of the child between 1-10 years

question: Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) is found in 30-40% of cases of which of the following?
A 12-year-old boy presents to the clinic because he is passing cola-colored urine for 5 days. He was diagnosed with malaria 2 weeks ago and is taking chloroquine. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a complication of a massive blood transfusion?
A 35-year-old man presents to the clinic with easy fatigability and weakness. Spherocytes can be seen on peripheral blood smear. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a platelet inhibitor?
Which of the following does not happen in platelet disorders?
A cord blood sample of an Rh-ve mother was sent for laboratory testing during labor. Which of the following would indicate the need for blood exchange transfusion?

answers.option: Indirect coombs test is weakly negative

question: Which of the following is the most common clinical manifestation in Von Willebrand's disease?
A 20-year-old man whose femur got fractured in a road traffic accident is bleeding profusely from the fracture site. What should he be transfused with?
A 20-year-old man is brought into the emergency after a road traffic accident. As a result, he is suspected to be infected by tetanus. Which of the following vaccine will be given to this man?
Which of the following would the 2nd line treatment for a patient suffering from sickle cell anemia?
How much hemoglobin and hematocrit are increased respectively when one pint of blood is transfused?

A man presents to the emergency with weakness. On examination, Reed-Sternberg cells were found along with swelling of a lymph node. There were no systemic symptoms reported. The doctor concluded his condition as Hodgkin lymphoma. What is the stage of lymphoma in this patient?
Which of these is not prepared from human blood?
What is the daily requirement of iron in pregnant females?
What is the diagnostic test for Hodgkin lymphoma?

answers.option: The site of lymph node involved
Checking tenderness of the lymph nodes

question: If a lady had a missed abortion, which of the following is the most suitable transfusion for her?

answers.option: Platelets and packed red blood cells

question: A patient has presented with iron deficiency anemia and was prescribed treatment with iron supplements. Which single test would show early response to the treatment?

A 29-year-old female comes for a routine checkup as part of a pre-employment requirement. Her complete blood count reveals Hb= 10 gm/dL with microcytic hypochromic red cell indices. Assuming that she is a carrier of the beta-thalassemia trait, what will be the most likely findings on her hemoglobin electrophoresis to confirm her carrier status?

answers.option: Normal HbA and A2, but slightly increased HbF
Normal HbA and increased Hb A2 (3-5%)
Decreased HbA,and raised HbA2 and HbF
Normal HbA and increased Hb A2 (4-8%)
Normal HbA and A2, but markedly increased HbF (>90%)

question: A 40-year-old male bed-bound from paraplegia is diagnosed with deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in his right leg. He develops a sudden onset of shortness of breath. A subsequent diagnosis of pulmonary embolism is made. What will be the most common initial electrocardiography (ECG) finding?

A 20-year-old male is brought to the outpatient department with a history of painless cervical lymphadenopathy and a physician is suspecting malignancy. What is the key investigation required to get a diagnosis?

A 20-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a history of fever and night sweats for the past two months. On examination, multiple cervical lymph nodes are palpable which are painless and matted. Which of the following is the single best diagnostic option?

answers.option: High levels of erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)

question: Which of the following is the correct sequence of steps in bone marrow transplantation?

A 21-year-old female presents with petechiae on her skin and episodes of epistaxis for the last two months. On examination, there is no hepatosplenomegaly or lymphadenopathy. Which of the following is the most sensitive earliest test for making a diagnosis?

A 35-year-old male known case of chronic myeloid leukemia shows massive splenomegaly on clinical examination. Complete blood count (CBC) reveals WBC count=165x10^9/L, Hb= 9.0 gm/dL and platelets=510 X10^3. Which of the following targeted therapy is specific for chronic myeloid leukemia patients?

A 60-year-old patient presented with anorexia, weakness, paraesthesia, and mental changes. His tongue was red, tendon reflexes were diminished, and hemoglobin was 6 gm/dL with large red cells and hypersegmented neutrophils. Endoscopy revealed atrophic gastritis. Deficiency of which factor is likely to be responsible for his condition?

An 11-year-old girl presents with a petechial rash all over her body. Her bleeding time and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) are prolonged but the prothrombin time (PT) is normal. Her sister also suffers from a similar condition. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 16-year-old boy, known case of hemophilia, injures himself while playing football and develops hemarthrosis in his right knee. What is the best treatment option?
Which of these is a common manifestation of antiphospholipid syndrome?

A 17-year-old boy presents to the office with complaints of weakness and shortness of breath. On examination, he appears to have jaundice and also has splenomegaly. He was treated for malaria one week ago. Which test can be done to determine the cause of anemia?
A 4-year-old boy has a form of microcytic, hypochromic anemia. His skull X-ray shows a crew-cut appearance. Which form of thalassemia is most likely in this patient?

A 2-year-old boy presents with frontal and parietal bossing and a history of severe pallor for 1 month. His mother and father are first cousins. He has another sibling who has had blood transfusions. Hemoglobin electrophoresis shows an HbA1 of 15 percent and HbF of 85 percent. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the screening test of choice for deep venous thromboembolism?

A 15-year-old child presents with low-grade fever and a mass on the right side of the neck which has been enlarging for the past two weeks. The mass is an enlarged lymph node in the anterior cervical chain. It is firm, non-tender, and rubbery. Which test needs to be ordered to confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: Bone marrow aspiration and trephine biopsy

question: Which transfusion product of blood carries the highest risk of bacterial contamination?

A 55-year-old male has severe lumbar vertebral pain. His complete blood count shows normocytic normochromic anemia with a markedly raised erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The clinical diagnosis by the physician is multiple myeloma. Assuming that the clinical diagnosis is correct, what will be the most characteristic finding on the peripheral film of his peripheral smear?
A 32-year-old woman has given birth to a stillborn hydropic baby with hepatosplenomegaly. What will be seen in her hemoglobin electrophoresis?
A person undergoes ileal resection. After some days he develops weakness, shortness of breath, and anemia. Which anemia can it possibly be?
Due to which of the following preformed antibodies is the reaction caused in acute hemolytic reaction?
A 50-year-old man has large-sized red blood cells and hemoglobin is also below normal. Which of the following will he be prescribed?

A primigravida presents to the antenatal clinic at 10 weeks gestation for her first visit. Her blood group is B- and she has no history of abortions or miscarriages. What is the initial test that will be done?

A 32-year-old male came to the outpatient department complaining of fever, fatigue, weakness, weight loss, and night sweats. His blood report shows Hb: 9mg/dl, WBC: 82x 10E9, and platelets: 84x 10E9. Peripheral film review showed 69% blast cells. The patient was advised of bone marrow aspirate, trephine biopsy, and cytogenetics testing. In leukemic presentations, one of the following cells replaces the normal bone marrow cells to make it hypercellular?

A 25-year-old female patient comes to the outpatient department with a history of easy bruising and prolonged bleeding after a minor cut. Upon history, she also told the doctor that her siblings have a similar problem. What are the initial tests that should be done to screen for bleeding disorders?

answers.option: Complete blood count, Fibrinogen, PT, APTT
Complete blood count, bleeding time, factor VIII level.
Bleeding time, factor assay, bone trephine
Factor assay, complete blood count, thrombin time
Bleeding time, complete blood count, PT/APTT

question: A 72-year-old male came to the outpatient department complaining of fever, fatigue, weakness, weight loss, and night sweats. His blood report shows Hb: 8 mg/dl, WBC: 3.5 x 10E9, and platelets: 90 x 10E9. Peripheral film review showed dysplastic neutrophils. The patient was advised of bone marrow aspirate, trephine biopsy, and cytogenetics testing. Which of the following is not the morphological feature of dysplastic syndrome?
Which of the following hormone is produced by the liver for the synthesis of platelets from megakaryocytes?
Which of the following enzymes is regulated by hepcidin?
Iron is delivered to body tissues bound to which of the following molecules?
A patient is receiving heparin by continuous intravenous infusion. The doctor is most likely to ask the nurse to monitor which of the following symptoms?

A young male is brought to emergency with the complaint of yellow discoloration of the sclera, after taking trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole that some general physician prescribed for some infection, the details of which are unknown. Laboratory reports show Hb of 8.5 g/dl, normal platelets, and TLC, total bilirubin is 4.2 mg/dl with predominant indirect hyperbilirubinemia. Liver enzymes are normal. The patient gives a previous history of recurring episodic jaundice and lethargy in the past. The given explanation best corresponds to which one of the following?

A young female presented to the outpatient department with sudden onset of abdominal distention for 1 week. On examination, there is a fluid thrill, palmer erythema, and bilateral edema. Doppler ultrasound shows hepatic vein and inferior vena cava thrombosis. The thrombophilic profile shows a deficiency of proteins C and S. How long should we anticoagulate this patient?

A 28-year-old male gave a history of laparotomy due to intestinal perforation 1 month back, his mobility was reduced due to this condition and now he has developed right leg swelling and pain up to mid-thigh for the last 1 week which is progressing gradually. What will be the duration of anticoagulation in this patient?

A 36-year-old female with no known comorbidity comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of progressive right leg swelling, pain, and redness for the past 15 days. She also has a history of multiple 2nd-trimester miscarriages. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 30-year-old female with no known comorbidity comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of left lower limb swelling and redness for the last 15 days. She gives a history of multiple second-trimester miscarriages. What is the investigation of choice for this patient?

A 38-year-old female comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of easy bruisability, gum bleeding, and menorrhagia. The examination was unremarkable except for pallor. Lab reports show Hb at 6.5 g/dl, Total leukocyte count at 7.8/ cmm, and platelet count at 10,000 cmm, also reports are negative for antinuclear antibodies. Which of the following can be diagnosis for this patient?

A 16-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with the complaint of swelling of the right knee joint after trivial trauma. History is significant for similar incidences over the past 4 years. Their family history is positive for a bleeding disorder. Investigations show hemoglobin - 10 g/dL, white cell count - 5,000/uL, and platelets - 200,000/uL. Which of the following correctly describes the above-mentioned condition? (prothrombin time=pt, active partial thrombin time= aptt )

answers.option: Normal pt, normal appt, no need to mix
Prolonged pt, prolonged aptt, no correction on mixing
Prolonged pt, normal aptt, corrects on mixing
Normal pt prolonged, prolonged aptt , corrects on mixing
Prolonged pt, normal aptt, no correction on mixing

question: A guy got into a road traffic accident and sustained wounds on his leg. He does not have a history of prior tetanus vaccination. After decontamination of the wound, what will the next best management?

answers.option: Administer tetanus immune globulin (TIG) as well as tetanus toxoid and call him one month later for the second dose of tetanus toxoid
Tetanus toxoid and tetanus immune globulin (TIG)
Administer tetanus immune globulin (TIG) as well as tetanus toxoid and call him the next day for the second dose of tetanus toxoid

question: A child with sickle cell disease has taken all preventive measures against infections and factors that can precipitate sickling but still develops complications. What should be the next best step in management?
A patient presents to you with a history of sickle cell disease and recurrent vaso-occlusive crisis. Which of the following measures is the next best step to prevent a sickling crisis in the future?

answers.option: Ultrasound of carotid artery with timely transfusions

question: A 26-year-old woman comes to the outpatient clinic with complaints of rapid heart rate and easy fatigability. Laboratory workup reveals low hemoglobin and microcytic red cell size. Which of the following is the most suitable therapy?

A 65-year-old man with a known case of ischemic heart disease came to the emergency department with complaints of exertional chest pain and dyspnea for 15 days. On examination, the patient is markedly pale, and a CVS examination shows a systolic murmur. His complete blood count revealed hemoglobin of 6.5 g/dL with an MCV of 69 fl; serum iron and ferritin are low, with an increase in TIBC. What is the initial treatment option?

A 45-year-old man presented to the medical specialist with complaints of generalized weakness, exertional shortness of breath, and loose stools for one month. His complete blood count reveals a hemoglobin level of 7.2 g/dL with a mean corpuscular volume of 107 fl, a white blood cell count of 3800/microliter, and a platelet count of 89,000/microliter. Additionally, the peripheral blood smear indicates the presence of hypersegmented neutrophils. What are his symptoms most likely caused by?

A 15-year-old boy presented in medical OPD with features of anemia, along with it has growth retardation, prominent cheek bones, frontal bossing of the head, massive splenomegaly crossing the midline and jaundice. Family history is positive and also transfusion history. His CBC and peripheral blood film show hypochromic, MCV is 50fl, microcytic hypochromic anemia along with target cells present. Which investigation is required to diagnose the cause of anemia?

You are a healthcare worker in a rural clinic in Pakistan. A mother brings in her 9-month-old child for a routine checkup. According to the EPI schedule, he child is due for their next round of vaccinations as she has received all the previous vaccines. Which of the following vaccines is typically included in this round?
